<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Create New SLA"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/slas/new"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Creates a new service level agreement definition. SLAs specify response and resolution time targets that are applied to tickets to track service performance.

**Workflow Example**
1. Review available metrics: [GET /api/v1.0/metrics/types](/docs/api/slas/list-metrics) for metric type IDs.
2. Build the SLA definition in the request body (name, targets, applicable conditions).
3. Call this endpoint: [POST /api/v1.0/slas/new](/docs/api/slas/create-sla) with the SLA configuration.
4. Activate the SLA: [POST /api/v1.0/slas/\{SlaId\}/activate](/docs/api/slas/activate-sla) to enable it.

**Related Endpoints:**
- [GET /api/v1.0/slas](/docs/api/slas/list-slas) - List all SLAs
- [POST /api/v1.0/metrics/for/sla/\{id\}](/docs/api/slas/create-metric-by-id) - Configure metrics for the SLA
